result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven L. Balistreri

Defendant Steven L. Balistreri in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Steven L. Balistreri.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Trial dates set. Minutes filed.

Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Randomly reassigned:  Case will remain assigned to Judge Koss after August 1, 2022.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven L. Balistreri not in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Steven L. Balistreri. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant recently sentenced in Waukesha. WRIT needs to be done. Case to be re-assigned, clerk to notify the parties. Minutes filed.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH FLEET FARM. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1201

3:003 PM  Defendant Steven L. Balistreri appeared by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Steven L. Balistreri.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Renner acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to the charge on behalf of her client. Speedy Trial reserved.

Bond Hearing - Attorney Renner is requesting defendant's bond be amended to a signature bond. State has no objection. Probation agent will be proceding with revocation.
Court amends bond to a Signature bond, same conditions.

Adj. 3:08 PM
Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

J.J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven Lawrence Balistreri appeared in court, in custody by video with attorney Leah Selmek. Right to attorney options form given; defendant referred to SPD. Defendant did not contact SPD, bond set over weekend. State asking for the end of the week to make charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
